Belgium:
Battle of Lekkerbeetje in the countryside outside 's-Hertogenbosch
Estates General meet in Brussels.
Battle of Nieuwpoort between the armies of Maurice of Nassau and the Archduke Albert.
Burma: Nyaungyan restores central rule to Upper Burma and Shan States (to 1606)
Chile:
Huaynaputina begins its catastrophic eruption.
In the Battle of Castro a Spanish force defeat and expel Huilliche rebels and Dutch corsairs from Castro.
Colombia: Huaynaputina volcano in Peru erupted catastrophically, in the largest volcanic explosion in South America in historic times causing a volcanic winter, with deadly effects reaching as far as Russia
East_Timor: Portugal opened a trade route with East Timor.
Germany: The period of Meistersinger lyric poets ended.
India: East India company is formed in England. Gets exclusive trading rights with India.
Indinesia:
The Portuguese win a major naval battle in the bay of Ambon. Later in the year, the Dutch join forces with the local Hituese in an anti-Portuguese alliance, in return for which the Dutch would have the sole right to purchase spices from Hitu.
Elizabeth I grants a charter to the British East India Company beginning the English advance in Asia.
Japan: The Battle of Sekigahara is won by forces of Tokugawa Ieyasu.
Philippine: The Dutch attacks the archipelago in a tactical offensive during the European war between Spain and the Netherlands
Bandala System is formed by the Spanish Colonial Government
The Galleon trade between Manila and Acapulco, Mexico begins.
